title: How to Use a Chinese Calligraphy Brush

steps.title: Soak it in a cup of water.
steps.content: Soak it in a cup of water. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Take the brush out when it is soft.
steps.content: Take the brush out when it is soft.

steps.title: Hold the brush in your right or left hand.
steps.content: Hold the brush in your right or left hand. Holding the brush higher creates weaker, softer strokes while holding closer to the bristles create solid, more defined strokes. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use your ring finger, middle finger and thumb to hold the brush.
steps.content: Use your ring finger, middle finger and thumb to hold the brush. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Keep your elbow above the table.
steps.content: Keep your elbow above the table.

steps.title: Dip the ink stick in water and grind against the ink stone until the ink has an oily consistency.
steps.content: Dip the ink stick in water and grind against the ink stone until the ink has an oily consistency. [4] X Research source See how to grind ink.

steps.title: Bottled ink:
steps.content: Bottled ink: Pour ink into the ink stone. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Begin writing characters, tilting the brush using the fingers, not the hands.
steps.content: Begin writing characters, tilting the brush using the fingers, not the hands. Tilting the brush can add certain effects to the character that may or may not be desirable. [6] X Research source
